fr:mainmatter.fr:p: This follows immediately from the spectral sequence in applied to \mathscr {A}(-m) and \mathscr {B}, since we then have that E_2^{p,q}(\mathscr {A}(-m),\mathscr {B}) = \operatorname {H}^p(X,\mathscr {E}\kern -1.5pt\mathit {xt}_{\mathcal {O}_X}^q(\mathscr {A}(-m),\mathscr {B})) = \operatorname {H}^p(X,\mathscr {E}\kern -1.5pt\mathit {xt}_{\mathcal {O}_X}^q(\mathscr {A},\mathscr {B})(m)) which is zero for p>0 and large enough m.

Let \mathscr {A} and \mathscr {B} be coherent algebraic sheaves on X, and let \mathscr {A}(m)=\mathscr {A}\otimes \mathcal {O}_X(m). Then, for large enough m, the canonical homomorphism \operatorname {Ext}_{\mathcal {O}_X}^i(X;\mathscr {A}(-m),\mathscr {B}) \to \operatorname {H}^0(X,\mathscr {E}\kern -1.5pt\mathit {xt}_{\mathcal {O}_X}^i(\mathscr {A}(-m),\mathscr {B})) = \operatorname {H}^0(X,\mathscr {E}\kern -1.5pt\mathit {xt}_{\mathcal {O}_X}^i(\mathscr {A},\mathscr {B})(m)) is an isomorphism.

This follows immediately from the spectral sequence in applied to \mathscr {A}(-m) and \mathscr {B}, since we then have that E_2^{p,q}(\mathscr {A}(-m),\mathscr {B}) = \operatorname {H}^p(X,\mathscr {E}\kern -1.5pt\mathit {xt}_{\mathcal {O}_X}^q(\mathscr {A}(-m),\mathscr {B})) = \operatorname {H}^p(X,\mathscr {E}\kern -1.5pt\mathit {xt}_{\mathcal {O}_X}^q(\mathscr {A},\mathscr {B})(m)) which is zero for p>0 and large enough m.
